metadata.title: CVE-2022-31740 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
On arm64, WASM code could have resulted in incorrect assembly generationleading to a register allocation problem, and a potentially exploitablecrash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.10, Firefox < 101, andFirefox ESR < 91.10.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31740` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
